Sentencas: Samaria-doped ceria (SDC)/carbonate composite electrolytes were developed for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: SDC powders were prepared by oxalate co-precipitation method and used as the matrix phase.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: Binary alkaline carbonates were selected as the second phase, including (Li-Na)(2)CO3, (Li-K)(2)CO3 and (Na-K)(2)CO3.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: AC conductivity measurements showed that the conductivities in air atmosphere depended on the salt composition.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: A sharp conductivity jump appeared at 475 degrees C and 450 degrees C for SDC/(Li-Na)(2)CO3 and SDC/(Li-K)(2)CO3, respectively.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: However, the conductivities of SDC/(NaK)(2)CO3 increase linearly with temperature.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: Single cells based on above composite electrolytes were fabricated by dry-pressing and tested in hydrogen/air at 500-600 degrees C. A maximum power density of 600, 550 and 550 mW cm(-2) at 600 degrees C was achieved with SDC/ (Li-Na)(2)CO3, SDC/(Li-K)(2)CO3 and SDC/(Na-K)(2)CO3 composite electrolyte, respectively, which we attribute to high ionic conductivities of these composite electrolytes in fuel cell atmosphere.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: We discuss the conduction mechanisms of SDC/carbonate composite electrolytes in different atmospheres according to defect chemistry theory.
Titulo: Effects of salt composition on the electrical properties of samaria-doped ceria/carbonate composite electrolytes for low-temperature SOFCs
